profileAlternative.name: Zac Gordon
profileAlternative.headline: Educator
profileAlternative.summary:
I am an experienced educator training students, teachers and professionals on the fundamentals, best practices, and latest trends on the web. At the moment, I am particularly focused on JavaScript and WordPress Development.

I also own Web Hosting for Students, the world's leading hosting company dedicated to providing students and teachers hosting accounts for learning how to design, build and develop on the web.

positions.title: Educator
positions.description: Create courses, run online bootcamps, host live and recorded shows for developers, put on a virtual conference, promote other educators.

positions.description: Oversee the direction of one of the world's leading Web Hosting Companies dedicated to Students, Teachers and Schools.

positions.title: Consultant
positions.description: Provided consulting on iterative recording practices and pedagogical best practices.

positions.title: Trainer and Coach
positions.description: Create online courses and offer one on one coaching about best practices for WordPress agencies and developers.

positions.title: JavaScript Coach
positions.description: Led monthly JavaScript Study Group Sessions, education on JavaScript, and discussions of technology stacks and implementation practices.

positions.title: Workshop Instructor
positions.description: Led workshops at Day of REST and Week of REST in person events. Taught JavaScript, React and WordPress API Driven Development.

positions.title: Trainer
positions.description: I serve as a stand in trainer and educator at Materiel, which does great WordPress related education projects. This includes client training on custom WordPress projects as well as public presentations and talks on Materiell's education related projects.

positions.title: WordPress Teacher
positions.description:
I was the primary and lead WordPress teacher at Treehouse, producing 1-2 courses per month on both beginner and advanced WordPress content. This included managing guest teachers as well as determining the direction of WordPress education at Treehouse.

Was let go at the end of 2015 when Treehouse stopped teaching WordPress.

I would have hired him on the spot but he played hard to get. When I was finally able to bring him on board as an Experience Designer for Blackboard, he played a key role as an ideator, designer and front-end developer for Blackboard Learn, and also contributed toward the success of various client projects. Aside, Zac has an overflowing personality that is contagious and can lift up the mood of an entire department. One of the best things I love about Zac is that he is always game for everything: he can go from being a serious coder to a video maker to a rapper to a designer. Zac would make a tremendous additions to any teaching and learning environment.

Mr. Gordon is by far one of the best instructors I had while attending Springbrook High School!! I first met Mr. Gordon during my freshman year taking Honors US History when he was beginning his career as a teacher. Despite the fact that he was just starting his profession as an educator, I must say he was fantastic both inside and outside of the classroom!! While instructing, he always ensured that the classroom maintained an interactive atmosphere. He did not just lecture at students, but rather, he always ensured to involve the students so that they felt engaged all the while. He made history "fun" for his students!! I was fortunate enough to have Mr. Gordon as an instructor for the second time when I enrolled in the signature International Baccalaureate course titled Information Technology in a Global Society. He was an excellent educator!! Having seen him perform as a teacher in two different areas I can affirm that he is a teacher who deserves to be acknowledged for the service he is providing to his community. Plenty of people strive to teach, but they lack the necessary skills to deliver quality service to their students inside the classroom. This gentleman truly has mastered the art of teaching and he totally deserve a shout-out for his continuous effort to educate his students. He always had innovative ways to engage his students, which was something that always captivated me about Mr. Gordon's teaching style. He also looked out for his students beyond the walls of the classroom and that to me is an educator who loves what he does on a day-to-day basis. A happy, vibrant educator can make all the difference in the world for a student because he holds the secret to establishing the optimal teaching and learning environment - I could not think of anyone else who would do a better job than Mr. Gordon!!

Zac is one of the best teachers I've ever had. He is one of the rare "techies" who seems brilliant (to me, a graphic designer) and excited about what he does, and at the same time has not a trace of arrogance about him. He is a really encouraging teacher with great interpersonal skills.

Zac treats his contract workers with respect, and does not dictate solutions to the professionals he hires. Not only that, but he pays his contract workers even in the face of clients who are not paying him. I look forward to future work with Zac.

Zac is a very engaging and gifted instructor . He teaches a challenging, constantly, evolving subject and amazes me with the breadth of his knowledge of it. Zac shows a lot of passion for his work as a teacher as well as passion for the standards of the web. He has the ability to push his students beyond what they imagine they can do, and that is the trait of a true educator. Finally, his sense of humor and his humbleness keep him very approachable and I always look forward to my classes with him.

Mr. Zac Gordon is a creative, passionate, and visionary teacher who I have had the honor of knowing for three years as a colleague at Springbrook High School. I have been afforded the opportunity to experience his unique talents and capabilities as a teacher who shares my classroom, as his peer mentor, and as his friend. One does not come across a teacher of Mr. Gordon’s caliber often, a teacher who has passion, expertise, and student appeal. I have known Mr. Gordon as a peer in the Computer Science department for three years. His skill as a professional web designer who also runs his own company is an asset in his class. He routinely talks about experiences he has had with clients and gives real professional advice that students can trust. Professional experience does not always go hand in hand with teaching ability, but in Zac's case, it does. As his peer mentor, I have observed countless examples of Mr. Gordon’s pedagogical skill. His lessons are filled with metaphors, germane examples, and detailed instructions for creating web sites. He routinely reflects on the efficacy of his lessons and makes improvements. He spends hours planning and compiling resources in order to put his curriculum on the Internet to make his information more accessible to his students. I feel comfortable knowing that I have a peer that shares my same vision for our program, and I feel challenged to apply myself to my goals as much as Mr. Gordon.

received.text: I am so glad I connected with Muhammad!  His experience with cutting edge technology in JavaScript and WordPress has been such an asset to our project porting WordPress themes over to Gatsby themes.  His communication skills on top of that have helped him share with everyone HOW he does what he does through in depth tutorials.  If you have a chance to work with Muhammad on development or educational work, I suggest you go for it!

Lil is by far the most inspiring person I have ever had the pleasure of calling boss. 

She is constantly immersed in the latest trends and practices in project management, forward thinking design, and in general how to create a great team.  When she brought this back to our team it propelled us into being more creative and harder working people.

Any team that has Lil on board is lucky and will definitely notice the effects of having such an energetic and creative person on board!

In addition to working for Lil as a UX designer at Blackboard, I have also had the opportunity to teach web design at the college level along side her.  I could always tells students who graduated from her classes because they thought out of the box more than other students and in general had a stronger motivation to succeed in their studies.
